pageTitle: Johann Louw | South Africa Cricket | Cricket Players and Officials | ESPN Cricinfo
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {34255=Born April 12, 1979, Cape Town, Cape Province, 78341=4391 runs after 35, and 2354 outside top five, 58878=A hard-working and honest seamer, Johann Louw's career appeared to be heading along a familiar route for South Africans as he forged a solid stay in county cricket, but late in 2008 he was handed a call-up to the national one-day squad. Louw's main home has been Northamptonshire, but he also had a year with Middlesex in 2006. He has been a consistent performer in all formats, however has proved especially productive in one-day cricket. During some seasons he has been registered under the Kolpak banner, but in 2008 was Northamptonshire's official overseas signing. Any future county assignments will now have to come through that route if he goes onto make his ODI debut against Kenya. He is a more than useful batsman with a first-class average in the low 20s. Cricinfo staff October 2008, 62567=Jun 26, 2008, 64089=May 17, 2005, 63343=Jun 21, 2006, 74660=Numbers Game: Since 2009, teams batting first have a win-loss ratio which is 61% higher than it was between 2000 and 2008}
